title: Europe must build its own critical infrastructure
summary:
Amazon Web Services, or AWS, is the largest cloud provider in the United Kingdom. It holds between 40 and 50% of the market for Infrastructure-as-a-Service, and its technology underpins the National Health Service, the Ministry of Defence and a wide range of public utilities and private companies. When there’s an outage, therefore, the effect is […]

title: Cyprus joins European Space Agency as an Associate Member
summary: The Republic of Cyprus has signed an Associate Agreement with the European Space Agency, and is expected to become an Associate Member in the coming months.

title: Airbus, Leonardo and Thales agree to combine space businesses
summary:
Three of Europe’s largest aerospace companies have agreed to combine their space businesses into a new joint venture intended to better compete in the global market.
The post Airbus, Leonardo and Thales agree to combine space businesses appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Condensation defying gravity
summary: From dew at dawn to a foggy mirror after a shower, condensation is part of our daily lives on Earth. In space, microgravity alters how heat flows through gases and liquids, a potential enemy for spacecraft electronics needing to cool down in extreme environments.

title: ArianeGroup Awards €1.5M Contract to Réaltra for Ariane 6 Video Telemetry
summary:
Irish space electronics company Réaltra Space Systems Engineering has been awarded a €1.5 million contract by ArianeGroup to supply seven Independent Video Kits (VIKIs) that will provide live onboard video telemetry during Ariane 6 launches. In June 2019, Réaltra announced that it had been awarded a contract exceeding €1 million to design, develop, and deliver […]
The post ArianeGroup Awards €1.5M Contract to Réaltra for Ariane 6 Video Telemetry appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Ion-X to supply upgraded thruster for Univity’s VLEO 5G constellation
summary:
France-based propulsion startup Ion-X announced Oct. 23 it will provide an upgraded version of its electrospray thruster to Univity, a three-year-old French venture planning 1500 small 5G broadband satellites in VLEO.
The post Ion-X to supply upgraded thruster for Univity’s VLEO 5G constellation appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Hungary signs Artemis Accords
summary:
Hungary has become the latest country to sign the Artemis Accords, outlining norms of behavior for sustainable space exploration.

title: Quantum Space to launch first spacecraft in mid-2026
summary:
Quantum Space says it plans to launch its first Ranger spacecraft in mid-2026 to demonstrate its capabilities for national security missions.
